Greg Walden has been a tireless advocate for the people of Oregon’s 2nd District. As Chairman of @HouseCommerce, @RepGregWalden led many important issues, but particularly our efforts to combat the opioid crisis. I wish Greg & his family the best as he moves onto new adventures.
R.I.P. Congressman John Conyers.

Congrats to our men and women in uniform who risked their lives to take out the head of ISIS. Terrorists around the world should not continue to test the resolve of the U.S. and our allies in this fight. We will never relent.

I stopped by the Indiana State Police station District 35 to drop off unused medication thank you for participating in national Take Back Day. To find a location near you visit  http://Takebackday.dea.gov  pic.twitter.com/pR4IgomP8R

Saturday, October 26, 2019 will serve as a National Take Back Day giving you an opportunity to dispose of prescription drugs in a safe and responsible way.

Sadly, the Democrats continue to play politics by tabling this resolution tonight.

There is no reason Rep. Schiff, Speaker Pelosi, and the Democrats should be conducting an impeachment inquiry behind closed doors and without putting it to a vote on the House floor. This is a process that demands total transparency for the sake of the American people.

The City of Boonville, located in the Eighth Congressional District, will receive a $3.6 million loan and a $629,000 grant for water infrastructure improvements.

I am pleased to see the U.S. Department of Agriculture make an important investment in the water infrastructure of Indiana. Modern and reliable water infrastructure is vital to the economy and Hoosier families. https://www.courierpress.com/story/news/2019/10/18/usda-invests-4-2-million-renovate-boonville-water-utility-system/4023145002/ …

I met with community bankers from around Southwest Indiana today in Evansville. The Indiana banking community is vital to ensuring the success of Hoosier families and businesses and I enjoyed discussing the ways they serve the needs of their customers and local communities. pic.twitter.com/PnfdmIV7WB

That’s a wrap on the 2019 Student Leadership Summit! Thank you to the 230 students who attended. I hope you all left feeling inspired. Safe travels going home. 

#2019SLS pic.twitter.com/xQMjMT31LQ
Behind the scenes of a summit-wide selfie. #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/vOSkmev7X2

Think big because if you don’t think big nothing big will ever happen to you.

I offer these imparting words to the 2019 Student Leadership Summit that I tell my four kids. 

#2019SLS

Question to panel: What advice do you have for incoming freshmen on getting involved?

Grace: Join one club first and use that as a stepping stone and it will lead to other opportunities, I guarantee it!

#2019SLS

Question to panel: How did you pick a college?

Megan: Visit campus! Ask about internships or study abroad opportunities and about job placement percentages. Make yourself a pros and cons sheet. You want to make sure to make the right decision for the next four years. 

#2019SLS

Question to panel: What’s your advice on joining clubs/organization or running for an office as a freshman? 

Elizabeth: If you want to run for an office or position do it! Get out there and challenge yourself.

#2019SLS

Question to panel: What’s the biggest difference from high school to college?

Megan: Laundry! 

Bryce: I was expecting high school round two but was met with something incredibly harder so be prepared for how challenging it is at first. 

#2019SLS

Next up at the 2019 Student Leadership Summit is a panel of currently enrolled college students who are giving their advice and tips on how to handle the transition from high school to college. #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/ZCDNEbAHgJ

Communication is key during this game hosted by the @UEvansville Leadership Academy. A famous character is taped to each student’s back and they have to guess based on clues given by other students who that character is. What would your clues for these characters be? #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/zE2IcdlkpR
One of the @UEvansville Leadership Academy activities is the human knot, teaching students the importance of working together. #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/KAbM6IzlfJ

Since my first Student Leadership Summit in 2015, the @UEvansville Leadership Academy has coordinated and executed interactive leadership activities. We welcome them back today to the #2019SLS! pic.twitter.com/c1XFi39SVR
One of my favorite parts of the Student Leadership Summit is meeting the bright students from around the 8th District. #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/D2i1Xj59wJ
Sullivan High School always brings a solid group of students to the Student Leadership Summit. This year they brought 71 students to the #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/l105osbpAP
It’s lunchtime at the #2019SLS!
General Hauser leaves us with “Treat everyone well. People are your best assets so treat everyone with respect.” #2019SLS

Jeff Hauser takes questions from the students. A student asks about working as a team and if it’s difficult. 

“Being in the military, you have to have trust in others and rely on them. As an individual you cannot do it alone.” - Jeff Hauser #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/tQAem49o4W
“Everyone who was alive on Sept. 11, 2001 remembers where they were. It’s burned in their minds.” - Jeff Hauser #2019SLS
“The next seven days we were on a five minute alert - ready to go anywhere with a five minute notice. The whole nation was on alert.” - Jeff Hauser #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/XC0l4yzgUs

“On the afternoon of 9/11, two of our pilots were asked to leave their posts in Chicago to escort an unnamed aircraft. When approaching they quickly realized it was Air Force One with President Bush on board.” - Jeff Hauser #2019SLS
“September 11, 2001 was a clear in a million morning.” - Jeff Hauser #2019SLS

Jeff Hauser is up next for the #2019SLS! He’s a retired Brigadier General, Director of Terre Haute Regional Airport, former Assistant Adjutant General - Air, Indiana National Guard. He is giving his captivating recount of the events of September 11, 2001.

Lonnie leaves us with this “I’ve been blessed with opportunities. It’s cool to say you’ve done something but meaningless unless you pay it forward so taking other veterans kayaking on the Colorado River & seeing what it meant to them was the real reward.” -@RealLonnieB #2019SLS

.@RealLonnieB takes questions from students. A student asks what his next adventure is to which Lonnie replies he’s going to climb South American’s highest peak Mt. Aconcagua at over 22,000 ft. #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/8qJ4ysTule
“In this great nation we have got to dream. You’re all here today because someone believed in you and afforded you opportunities. Grasp those and do something good!” - @RealLonnieB #2019SLS
“You have to let things go in order to truly move forward.” @RealLonnieB #2019SLS

.@RealLonnieB speaks on overcoming a hunting accident which left him blind, “Blind, I mowed my yard, taught my daughter how to drive, and I built houses. Blindness is a part of me, but by itself does not define me.” #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/1VX5VMFziJ
“If we are willing to expand our vision, then we can think outside the box and beyond the status quo.” - @RealLonnieB #2019SLS
First speaker at the #2019SLS is @RealLonnieB, a blind adventure athlete, acclaimed motivational speaker, award-winning author, and military veteran!

.@VincennesU President Chuck Johnson welcomes high school students to campus, challenging them to ask themselves “How am I becoming a better leader? Whatever you do, find something you find passion with to better your community. Learning is a constant. Never stop.” #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/xLjuqwZmeC

There’s a full house for my fourth High School Student Leadership Summit. Almost 250 students from all over Indiana’s 8th Congressional District are ready to hear from a solid lineup of community leaders with inspirational stories. 
#2019SLS pic.twitter.com/Am9qEaeDqH

Students are checking into the 2019 Student Leadership Summit! 
#2019SLS pic.twitter.com/Yl87y6E6mP

@VincennesU President Chuck Johnson welcomes high school students to campus challenging them to ask themselves “How am I becoming a better leader everyday? Whatever you do find something you find passion in to better your community. Learning is a constant.”
The stage is set for the 2019 High School Student Leadership Summit in Vincennes! Make sure to follow along all day as I live tweet the speakers and activities. #2019SLS pic.twitter.com/nqxk4IYPRk

Today I took a harvest ride along with Be-N-Ag Farm, a family operated farm owned by Marty Evans, son Casey Evans, son in law Brad Burbrink and their families in rural Vigo County. As the tenth largest agricultural producer in the nation Hoosier farms like these are critical. pic.twitter.com/Yp2Xt7zfVK

Today I met with the Vermillion County Chamber of Commerce at Paradise Bowl in Clinton, Indiana. Established in 1953, their mission is to promote business development within and around Clinton and outlying communities in Vermillion County. Great lunch! pic.twitter.com/g0AADp3XWI

Great meeting today in Jasonville with Traver Wolf the owner of Shakamak pharmacy and other local pharmacists. I am working in D.C. to help keep community pharmacies competitive. They have many challenges facing them. pic.twitter.com/TMsmph82kf
Stopped in Linton today at one of my favorite coffee shops for a muffin and a Chai Tea. pic.twitter.com/MiMI30nlrm
Great meeting today at Pike Gibson Water with State Senator Jim Tomes. Discussed the Federal and State roles in assisting rural water utilities. pic.twitter.com/TYELMOZ7hq
